amendment.description: Amendment increases the minimum wage by 90 cents from $4.25 to $5.15 per hour over the next two years.
amendment.purpose: An amendment to increase the minimum wage by 90 cents per hour, thereby raising the minimum wage from its current level of $4.25 per hour to $5.15 per hour in two increments: by July 1, 1996 the wage would become $4.75 per hour and by July 1, 1997 the wage would be increased to $5.15 per hour.

action.text: Mr. Portman raised a point of order against the Riggs amendment (A002). Mr. Portman stated that the effect of the amendment offered by Mr. Riggs would violate the Budget Act by imposing an unfunded mandate. The Speaker ruled that the test of establishing a threshold burden had been met and the House proceeded with 20 minutes of debate on the point of order. After debate, the question will be put on whether to consider the Riggs amendment.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Riggs amendment (A002) Agreed to by recorded vote: 266 - 162 (Roll no. 192).
